sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>origin</radical> radical and the <kanji>origin</kanji> kanji are the same!
readingMnemonic:
The <kanji>origin</kanji> of everything can be found in <reading>Gen</reading>ji (<ja>げん</ja>). Genji is the name of the main character in the world's first ever novel, "The Tale of Genji." 

Picture him as a rich, pretty boy who cares a ton about his looks and gets along really well with all the ladies. He's also really great at poetry, which helps the lady situation.
readingInfo: Genji's origin story is pretty important when it comes to mnemonics and Japanese literature. He's going to keep popping up on your kanji journey, so make sure you remember him!
